chapter.title: Elements of the environment that promote self-determination
chapter.content:
Elements of the environment that promote self-determination

In this factor, the environment, we are switching from the perspective of a learner to the perspective of an instructor. Some learning or work environments may be set up to allow a person to work with his or her strengths and to gain self-insight through feedback. Other environments will be challenging because they emphasize the individual’s weaknesses or provide little opportunity for two-way communication about an individual’s performance strengths and needs.

Some elements of the environment that can promote self-determination include:

  • Providing clear learning objectives
  • Providing specific and timely feedback
  • Asking learners to track their progress
  • Setting tasks at the learners’ level, and
  • Encouraging learners to share strengths and needs

chapter.title: Questions related to the environment
chapter.content:
Questions related to the environment

A self-determined person can answer these questions:

  • Do I have input on how I meet learning objectives?
  • Do I give and receive specific feedback on my performance?
  • How do I tell if I am progressing?
  • Are the expectations too low or too high?

As service providers, our role is to determine how we can set up the learning environment to encourage development of all the factors of self-determination.

chapter.title: Activity: Identify ways to promote an supportive environment
chapter.content:
Activity: Identify ways to promote an supportive environment

Based on this information, and your own experiences, consider what you can do as a service provider to promote an environment that would develop adult participants’ self-determination.

Please write down for yourself at least one thing you can do to promote a classroom environment that supports individuals’ self-determination.

When you have finished recording your ideas, click the forward arrow to proceed.

chapter.title: Ideas for promoting a supportive environment
chapter.content:
Ideas for promoting a supportive environment

Some ideas for promoting an environment that supports the development of self-determination are:

  • provide choices,
  • ensure that communication between service provider and learner is culturally sensitive, and
  • ensure that the wealth of knowledge and experience that individuals bring to the environment is valued, respected and used.

Take a moment to compare your ideas with those listed.

 

 

Continue on to the Self-determination model when you are ready to move on.
